Message.Title: Federal Workers to Pay $35 Billion for Their Retirement Program

Topic.Title: Conservatives Regret Taking Woodward’s ‘Threat’ Story Seriously

Message.Msg: No one was claiming they were threatening his life, just his access. Already a number of other journalists have been banned from the White House news crew for asking inconvenient questions at difficult times. Woodward joining them will just be another drop in the bucket. Gene Sperling was a friend for pointing out to Woodward that the time was fast approaching when he might be joining the list as well. Now he knows, like the rest of the White House press corp, to temper his remarks about the President.

Ain't gonna happen, if the Senate is required to pass a budget it would mean the DNC actually taking a paper backed stand on something, thus giving Republicans something solid to criticize. It's MUCH better from their point of view to do NOTHING, and then blame EVERYTHING on the Republicans for not instantly becoming Democrats.

Message.Title: Anyone using E-trade X-Trader
Message.Msg: E-trade is switching from TT, X-Trader to E-Trade PRO. Very unhappy with this move. Is anyone on this board using TT and planning to switch to a different broker?

It's funny to watch you get punked by the administration at every manufactured crisis. Obama overplayed wif his hand on this one, lost credibility from all but the staunchest of his supports and looks for all the world the fool who cried woof.

Message.Title: Subject
Message.Msg: ABC 7, Los Angelos, CA: "Trips to the pump have not been especially kind to motorists as of late. But with prices well over $4 a gallon, drivers may be shocked to learn that the state of California is now raising the tax on a gallon of gas. "There will be a 3.5-cent change," said Jaime Garza, spokesman with the California Board of Equilization. That became official when the California Board of Equalization voted to approve the hike on Thursday. It's set to go into effect July 1." The board of 5 decides 38 millions of Californians do not pay enough for making their cars to move, going to work, bringing kids from to scool, shopping, vacationing. Who is that going to hurt? They are saying they worry about middleclass!
California is the leader of USA (Union States of America)

Topic.Title: Housing market up and DART up!

Message.Msg: Total customer assets will be up as well in Q1. Since housing market is recovering it is positive news for ETFC. DART is definately high in Q1. ETFC has tried to do cost cutting strategy. I am waiting for positive Q1 earning report at April.

Topic.Title: Media has created their own Frankenstein

Message.Msg: It wasn't the eMail that was threatening, remember he apologized for "raising his voice" to Woodward, e.g. the "you will regret it" came as a VERBAL exchange. The eMail's followed that exchange, so if you ONLY read the eMail's you get the idea there was no heat behind the comment until you read between the lines. Further the eMails themselves were fairly amiable. And he wasn't threatening Woodward in a personal way, just indicating that if he continued asking inconvenient questions he might, as an example, find himself perhaps barred from the Whitehouse press pool. In other words, "no hard feelings, it's just business". That kind of "amiability".

I don't do futures, so I'm content even without ETPro, I just use the ET360 app they're working on in combination with the web embedded tools. Of course if I was managing hundreds of millions I'd write my own platform and just take advantage of their data feed subscription.

Topic.Title: Conservatives Regret Taking Woodward’s ‘Threat’ Story Seriously

Message.Msg: Oh, and in developing news, another normally liberal columnist has reported he and through him his paper were also threatened with reduced access for criticizing Obama. Apparently Larry Davis of the Washington Times received a very similar message from the White House.

Topic.Title: Conservatives Regret Taking Woodward’s ‘Threat’ Story Seriously

Message.Msg: Yep. Apparently WH goes against their own loyal supporters. O'REILLY: Continuing now with our lead story. The Obama administration objecting to critical reporting of it. Speaking on the radio today, former Clinton advisor Lanny Davis said that while he was writing a column his editor was threatened by the Obama Administration. DAVIS: He received a phone call from a senior Obama White House official who didn't like some of my columns, even though I'm a supporter of him, I couldn't imagine why this call was made. And he did threaten and the word I was told was the word "threaten" by this editor that if he continued to run my columns, he would lose or his reporters would lose their White House credentials. DAVIS: "This one individual who called my editor made some very serious threats against me professionally." Bob Woodward was an outspoken critic of Bush administration Iraq war. Never received any threats from Bush WH. A veteran is scolded, threatened by the bosses he faithfully supports. This WH doesn't need reporters. Something reminds me good ol KGB and Soviet propaganda machine.

Topic.Title: Bob Woodward To Hannity: I Never Called WH Email A 'Threat,'

Message.Msg: "how many "mainstream" journalists are nothing more than shills for the right wing" Bob Woodward a right wing journalist? By amy means he wasn't in the Bush WH, nor anytime before now. Bob, decided he wants to remain a journalist, not an ode singer, that makes him right winger.

Topic.Title: When crickets invaded the White House!

Message.Msg: They wasn't crickets. It be a cockroach infested WH. Common mistake, lots of people get the two confused.

Topic.Title: When crickets invaded the White House!

Message.Msg: Crickets in he White House. Right. The one who instead of working playing golf and campaining. Serous cuts? Darn! Publish them! We want to see what you want to cut. So far we've seen sequestration cuts which president himself introduced and a year later criticized. Is that what he is bragging about? Making another 180 turn?
